Detailed Description

Interface of APS information base.

Author:
Microchip Corporation: http://www.microchip.com
Support email: support@microchip.com

Copyright (c) 2018, Microchip Corporation. All rights reserved. Licensed under Mirochip's Limited License Agreement.

Definition in file apsAIB.h.

Define Documentation

#define APS_AIB_NONMEMBER_RADIUS_DEFAULT_VALUE   2

The APS information base comprises the attributes required to manage the APS layer of a device. The attributes of the AIB are listed in ZigBee spec r19, Table 2.24, page 61. The securityrelated AIB attributes are described in sub-clause 4.4.10, page 489.

Definition at line 41 of file apsAIB.h.

#define APS_NO_SEC_CMD_NO_KEY   (1U << 0)

Bit masks for APS_SecurityPolicy_t type. The bit permits (1) (or prohibits(0)) processing of an unsecured APS command for which there is no link key associated with the device that sent the command.

Definition at line 45 of file apsAIB.h.

#define APS_NO_SEC_CMD_GLOBAL_KEY   (1U << 1)

The bit permits (1) (or prohibits(0)) processing of an unsecured command when the GLOBAL link key exists.

Definition at line 48 of file apsAIB.h.

#define APS_NO_SEC_CMD_UNIQUE_KEY   (1U << 2)

The bit permits (1) (or prohibits(0)) processing of an unsecured command when there is a UNIQUE link key for the device that sent the command.

Definition at line 51 of file apsAIB.h.

#define APS_SEC_CMD_GLOBAL_KEY   (1U << 3)

The bit permits (1) (or prohibits(0)) processing of a secured command that was encrypted with the GLOBAL link key.

Definition at line 54 of file apsAIB.h.

#define APS_SEC_CMD_UNIQUE_KEY   (1U << 4)

The bit permits (1) (or prohibits(0)) processing of a secured command that was encrypted with a UNIQUE link key.

Definition at line 57 of file apsAIB.h.

#define APS_ENCRYPT_OUT_CMD_BY_GLOBAL_KEY   (1U << 5)

The bit indicates that the APS layer should encrypt an APS command with the GLOBAL link key.

Definition at line 59 of file apsAIB.h.

#define APS_ENCRYPT_OUT_CMD_BY_UNIQUE_KEY   (1U << 6)

The bit indicates that the APS layer should encrypt an APS command with a UNIQUE link key.

Definition at line 61 of file apsAIB.h.

#define APS_IS_DUP_CMD_REQUIRED   (1U << 7)

The bit controls transmission of unsecured duplicate command.

Definition at line 63 of file apsAIB.h.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum _APS_TcMode_t
Enumerator:
APS_NOT_TRUST_CENTER 

The device is not a trust center.

APS_CENTRALIZED_TRUST_CENTER 

The device is the common trust center for the whole network.

APS_DISTRIBUTED_TRUST_CENTER 

The device is one of multiple trust centers (this may happen when the network configuration allows any router to serve as a trust center).

Definition at line 141 of file apsAIB.h.

Function Documentation

void APS_SetTrustCenterAddress ( const ExtAddr_t *  addr)

Set the Trust Center address.

Parameters:
[in]addr- pointer to the extended address to set
Returns:
none
void APS_SetTrustCenterNwkAddress ( const ShortAddr_t  addr)

Set the Trust Center NWK address.

Parameters:
[in]addr- NWK address of Trust Center
Returns:
none
bool APS_IsTcAddress ( const ExtAddr_t *  addr)

Check whether supplied extended address is the address of Trust Center.

Parameters:
[in]addr- pointer to an extended address
Returns:
true, if the provided address is the TC's address, false - otherwise
ExtAddr_t* APS_GetTrustCenterAddress ( void  )

Get a pointer to the Trust Center address.

Returns:
pointer to the Trust Center extended address
ShortAddr_t* APS_GetTrustCenterNwkAddress ( void  )

Get a pointer to the Trust Center Network address.

Returns:
pointer to the Trust Center network address
APS_TcMode_t APS_GetOwnTcMode ( void  )

Gets the trust center role of the current device.

Returns:
The device's role as a trust Center:
  • APS_NOT_TRUST_CENTER - not a trust center,
  • APS_CENTRALIZED_TRUST_CENTER - a single trust center in the network,
  • APS_DISTRIBUTED_TRUST_CENTER - one of multiple trust centers (each router can be a trust center).
bool APS_IsTrustCenter ( void  )

Check whether the node is the Trust Center or not.

Returns:
true, if the node is one of distributed trust centers or the centralized trust center; otherwise return false.
bool APS_IsTrustedAddress ( const ExtAddr_t *  addr)

Check whether the provided extended address is a trusted address.

Parameters:
[in]addr- a pointer to an extended address to check
Returns:
true, if the argument is the address of the centralized Trust Center or there are multiple trust centers in the network (distributed TC mode enabled), otherwise return false.
void APS_UpdateSecurityPolicy ( const APS_SecurityPolicyId_t  spid,
const APS_SecurityPolicy_t  policy 
)

Updates security policy for the command with a given security policy ID.

Parameters:
[in]spid- security policy identifier of the command
[in]policy- bit map where each bit permits or prohibits processing of an incoming command and determines how to encrypt an outgoing command with the given spid
Returns:
None
